cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 203 (Monday, December 11, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DAVIDSON:H.R. 6695.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8 of the U.S. ConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:To authorize private parties to compel the Securities andExchange Commission to seek sanctions by filing civilactions.[Page H6815]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

cdata.text:
Due Process Restoration Act of 2023

This bill allows a person who is the target of a Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) administrative proceeding to terminate the proceeding. The SEC is then authorized to bring a civil action in a U.S. district court against that person.

item.title: To authorize private parties to compel the Securities and Exchange Commission to seek sanctions by filing civil actions, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
